lines.text: Missed me?
I don't suppose you want to hear my side of this?
Dead? She's not only alive, she's bigger! What did you do, try to kill her with a Grow Lite?
[Dr. Loeb sees the giant Nancy for the first time]
This is impossible.
Well, that certainly takes a load off my mind. I thought I had a problem.
What made her grow like that?
You menctioned that she began growing when she got angry. Clearly it's stress related. The blood tests show that her hormone levels are abnormally high.
Congratulations, Doctor. You've just discovered a new kind of PMS.
You were sad before, but now you're just a big joke. If only you knew half of what Honey Parker knows about how to be a real woman.
Insect! Tick! I offer you a landscape and you cling to a glass doorknob!
She was better in bed that you ever were. She's even better than your cousin Vera.
Vera? You slept with Vera? I'll kill her, but first, I'm going to pop your head like a Concord grape!
It doesn't seem right to fire an air-to-ground missile at a woman.
Don't think of her as a woman. Think of her as a target. That's what I do.
The world is my doll house, Dr. Cushing.
I'm not saying the old Nancy isn't there. I can still hear her inside me, stumbling in the dark, bumping into things, always apologizing. But less and less. Less and less.
What will she do if she finds him?
Ball him up like a used Kleenex.
Good.
Don't be stupid your whole damn life. You're better than they are, you're smarter than they are, and you know more than you think.
*Jesus*! This is just so *fucking* romantic I could *puke*!
